thread.title: Michael Thomas helps Fort Pierce take their "First Step"
thread.title_full: Michael Thomas helps Fort Pierce take their "First Step"

title: Michael Thomas helps Fort Pierce take their "First Step"
text:
Golf Stories Michael Thomas helps Fort Pierce take their "First Step" 
Miami Dolphins safety Michael Thomas has absolutely no ties to Fort Pierce, yet he drove two and a half hours from Miami today to help the community take their "First Step*. That's the name of a program hoping to bridge the gap between community leaders and potentially troubled youth. Most of the kids from Fort Pierce had never experinced their community park quite like they did on Tuesday, playing in a football game led by Thomas, hoping to spread some inspiration in a park that's hardly ever been utilized. "There's more to life regardless of what situation they're in," says Thomas, "regardless of what circumstances, there's something to look forward to."It's the third straight week "The First Step" program has brought police, firefighters, and now NFL stars, together with kids growing up in a neiborhood all too often known for it's anger, violence, and bad influences."Here's a guy who has no ties," says The First step founder Scott Van Duzer, "and for him to come up here on his half day come on man, if more people did that this World would be much better.""He motivates us to stay in school get good grades," says one kid, "and achieve your dream and be who you want to be.""Seeing the smile on their face man, I can't explain it," says Thomas, "when I was a kid their age that's what I wanted, I wanted somebody to come back and show me that it is possible to make it." Michael Thomas helps Fort Pierce take their "First Step" 
Wednesday, October 21 2015, 12:00 AM
